hedline.hl1: Fallon and Ogilvy Share Top Award

abstract.p: New York offices of Fallon Worldwide and Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide each take top honors at Athena Awards ceremony, sponsored by Newspaper Association of America for creative advertising (S)

block.p: The New York offices of Fallon Worldwide and Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide each took top honors at the Athena Awards ceremony last night in New York, sponsored by the Newspaper Association of America for creative advertising.

Fallon, part of the Publicis Groupe S.A., shared the grand prize for a tribute to Andre Agassi by the United States Tennis Association. The creators were: Jamie Barrett, creative director and copywriter; Brian Murphy, art director; and Louise Raicht, producer.

The New York offices of Fallon Worldwide and Ogilvy & Mather Worldwide each took top honors at the Athena Awards ceremony last night in New York, sponsored by the Newspaper Association of America for creative advertising.

Fallon, part of the Publicis Groupe S.A., shared the grand prize for a tribute to Andre Agassi by the United States Tennis Association. The creators were: Jamie Barrett, creative director and copywriter; Brian Murphy, art director; and Louise Raicht, producer.

And Ogilvy, part of the WPP Group, shared the grand prize for a 32-page insert for the electronic business services unit of I.B.M. The creators were: Arturo Gigante and John McNeil, art directors; Victoria Ludwin, copywriter; Mike Penzo, producer; Josh Tavlin, creative director and copywriter; and Chris Wall, creative director.
The top multiple winner, with five Athenas, was Work Inc. in Richmond, Va., which won for clients like the Main Street Beer Company.
